body:
>Have just updated to v3.0.5 (from 3.0.3)

are you saying it's a regression? Can you confirm and maybe help?
What is the value of your horizontal bar chart?

> are you saying it's a regression? 

yes - worked as expected in previous version. i found a screenshot from earlier version. Happy to help if i can. Is there a quick fix I can apply in meantime?

![2018-02-27_09-56-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16882814/36722314-1a52dba8-1ba5-11e8-97da-e0bfaeeb256b.png)

> What is the value of your horizontal bar chart?

What do you mean?
@liuxuan30 is there something that I can do to help / test this?

go back to old versions and check if the issue is gone. as you said 
> Have just updated to v3.0.5 (from 3.0.3)
@liuxuan30 yes - reverting to 3.0.3 fixes the issue.
you could help debug and maybe fix it. I just release 3.1, but seems not fixing this issue, as I didn't know what's the regression
@mallow76 Does the issue still exist in 3.1?
as a temporary fix i just used `chart.extraBottomOffset`

I have the same issue in my actual app with Charts v3.2.1.
The fix is quite easy. I can create a pull request at the weekend which fixes the issue.

issue.title: Fix legend offset bug for horizontal bar chart (Fixes #3301)

repository.name: Charts
repository.description: Beautiful charts for iOS/tvOS/OSX! The Apple side of the crossplatform MPAndroidChart.

issue.body:
### Issue Link :link:
Horizontal Bar Chart legend issue #3301

### Goals :soccer:
This PR fixes the legend offset issue in case of horizontal bar charts.

### Implementation Details :construction:
The guard conditions in the method `calculateLegendOffsets` in the file `HorizontalBarChartView.swift` were wrong.

### Testing Details :mag:
Tested in own app.
